anomalies.message: [ESCALATE] High ML-derived risk indicators and a missing written-amount field necessitate manual review.
High ML risk scores (72.7% RF & XGB)
New customer with zero transaction history
Manually compare written vs. numeric amount
Confirm purchaser ID and signature authenticity
Validate serial number and issuance details with Western Union

ai_analysis.summary: High ML-derived risk indicators and a missing written-amount field necessitate manual review.
reasoning: Random Forest and XGBoost both flag a 72.7% fraud risk (well above typical alert thresholds).
The ensemble’s 0.0% “score” is likely a data glitch; we rely on the consistent 72.7% sub-model outputs.
Missing written-amount entry—training data shows 45% of frauds involve amount mismatches.
New customer with no prior history or trust indicators raises additional concern.
No past similar cases to mitigate risk; issuer/serial number authenticity and signature legitimacy need verification.
key_indicators: High ML risk scores (72.7% RF & XGB)
New customer with zero transaction history
Manually compare written vs. numeric amount
Confirm purchaser ID and signature authenticity
Validate serial number and issuance details with Western Union
actionable_recommendations: Verify the purchaser’s government-issued ID on file
Contact Western Union to authenticate the serial number and issuance date
Obtain and compare the written-amount inscription to the numeric value
